facts: The word "denim" comes from "de Nîmes," a phrase linked to a strong fabric once made in the French city of Nîmes.
Velcro was inspired by burrs that stick to animal fur, and its hook-and-loop design copies how those burrs grab on.
Wool can keep you warm even when it is damp because its fibers trap air and still provide insulation.
Most modern clothes use a mix of fibers, like cotton and polyester, to balance comfort, strength, and easy care.
Buttons have been used for thousands of years, first as decorations and later as fasteners for clothing.
Reflective strips on jackets and shoes help drivers see people at night by bouncing light back toward its source.
Washing clothes in cold water often helps colors last longer and can use less energy than washing in hot water.
